title: Know the Context: Here's What Singapore's PM Said About Nehru, Criminal Cases Against India's MPs - The Wire
content:
1. Know the Context: Here's What Singapore's PM Said About Nehru, Criminal Cases Against India's MPs  The Wire
  2. 'Uncalled for...': India strongly objects to Singapore PM's remarks on 'Tainted MPs'; Summons envoy  Hindustan Times
  3. Delhi objects to Singapore PM remark on ‘tainted’ Indian MPs  Times of India
  4. Singapore PM's Speech Uncalled for, Says India  IndianExpressOnline
  5. Singapore PM's Remarks On Indian MPs With Criminal Records Uncalled For: Government Sources  NDTV
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong's Parliament speech in which he contrasted Jawaharlal Nehru's India with Modi's had the Union government up-in-arms. In focusing on only those few paragraphs, they are missing an impassioned plea for upholding democratic standards.
